Sentence: Peck is waiting for him (Robert) and ushers him (Robert) inside because Robert's Aunt Matty is over for a visit
Robert greets her (Peck), and then shows his (Robert) mother, Aunt Carrie, and then Aunt Matty his (Robert) report card
As the only one among them who can read, Matty is shocked by the 'D' that Robert has gotten in English, even though he (Robert) got `A's in every other subject
Aunt Matty immediately determines the problem and tries to teach Robert how to diagram sentences
When he (Robert) cannot, Matty simply does it all for him (Robert)
